name: The Courtyard Baithak- An Evening of Hindustani Classical Music
description: This will be Courtyard Baithak's first classical recital. The Baithak will feature Khayal, Thumri, and Abhang by Siddhartha Belmannu.The Courtyard Baithak series is curated by tabla wizard and prodigy Trilochan Kampli, who with his uncompromising standards in music, evokes the best from every artist that he invites to perform. We are bringing musicians and audiences together on a sublime musical journey.Exclusive gatherings, quiet strains of exquisite music, and dedicated artists across selected genres - The Courtyard Baithak series promises a true classical musical experience.Please note: The ticket includes performance onlyAbout the Artist - Siddhartha BelmannuSiddhartha Belmannu is acclaimed as a musical prodigy and a trailblazer in Indian classical music. Hailing from Karkala, a quaint town in the Udupi district of Karnataka, Siddhartha’s remarkable vocal talent was evident from an early age. His musical journey began with Carnatic Classical Music, but it was under the esteemed guidance of Sri P.R. Manjunath that he delved into Hindustani Classical Music. His path took a transformative turn with the mentorship of Pandit Vinayak Torvi, a revered maestro of the Gwalior and Kirana gharanas. This extensive training, spanning 13 years in the Gurukul system, allowed Siddhartha to refine his skills and create a distinct style that harmoniously blends tradition with contemporary innovation. His exceptional achievements earned him a special mention in Forbes’ '30 under 30' list for 2021 in the music category.Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Children aged 5 and older require a ticket.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Hosa, Goa at The Conservatory | Chef Harish Rao’s Experiments with South Indian Tapas
description: About the MealCurated by Harish Rao, Executive Chef, Hosa, the menu offers a blend of traditional and modern dishes. Guests can savor unique creations like Pondicherry Bouillabaisse, Chicken Paniyaram, Kari Dosa and Mutton Pepper Roast—each crafted to showcase the rich culinary heritage of South India.About Chef Harish RaoChef Harish Rao is a celebrated culinary expert with over 20 years of experience, renowned for his innovative approach to South Indian cuisine. He has successfully led prestigious restaurants like Dakshin in Chennai and played a key role in launching Avartana at ITC Grand Chola. As the Executive Chef at HOSA, Goa, he continues to introduce exciting new dishes that highlight the intricate and diverse flavors of traditional South Indian regional cuisines.About HosaHOSA, meaning ‘new’ in Kannada, redefines South Indian flavors with an innovative twist and a vibrant bar scene. HOSA’s menu features standout dishes like Guntur Crab Fry, ghee roasts, Vada Kari and Curry Leaf-Cured Snapper, all paired with tropical cocktails and an extensive wine list. Recognized as Goa’s ‘Best Modern Indian Restaurant’ and ‘Best Restobar’ by the Times Food & Nightlife Awards in 2023, HOSA also earned accolades in 2024 for ‘Best Modern South Indian’ and ‘Best Cocktails.’ They received four ultimate stars from Culinary Culture Co. 2024HOSA (A la carte menu)Small PlatesVegetarianTengaipal Rasam (400)Spiced young coconut broth, smoked coconut meat, tomato salsa, coriander oilAlmond 65 (600)Crispy almond fritters, yogurt rice, pomeloVazhakai Pepper Roast (600)Raw plantain tossed in onion tomato pepper masalaShimiji Mushroom Varuval (700)Mushroom mousse, pickled green peppersNon-VegetarianKozhi Rasam (600)Spiced chicken broth, chicken varuvalMutton Pepper Roast (810)Coconut shavings, garlic chipsH F C (Hosa Fried Chicken) (700)Cucumber yogurt dipToddy Shop Prawns (850)Raw mango saladKari Dosa (700)Spiced mutton dosa, curried hollandaise, poached eggs. A take on classic Madurai kari dosaLarge PlatesVegetarianTrumpet Mushroom Varuval (840)Wild mushroom pongal, pepper jusAubergine Steak (840)Burnt aubergine mash, sesame peanut curry, yogurt sphereSweet and Sour Pineapple (700)Chargrilled sweet and sour pineapple curryNon-VegetarianKappa Meen Curry (1200)Tapioca mash, grilled seabass, Malabar tamarind sauceG.O.A.T (1200)Tender lamb shank simmered in spicy gravyChicken Serva / Kalaki (830)Our take on the local street foods of Tamil NaduStaples (195 each)Coin PorottaIdiappam – String HoppersSteamed RiceGhee Rice (250)Desserts (550)Ragi Molten Lava CakeOrange ice cream, almond crumbleDegree Coffee TiramisuCoffee, ruskTerms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. name: Onam Sadhya - A taste of Kerala
description: Chef Mako, a half Malayali, and Akash Murali, a Kerala-born chef , are coming together to curate a unique Onam Sadhya experience at Love Ooru, Koramangala. This collaboration promises a festive feast that showcasing a rich array of traditional dishes prepared with fresh, local ingredients. Join them for an unforgettable culinary journey that honors the spirit of Kerala’s most cherished festival.This curated community-style vegetarian lunch will include a 29-dish spread including Kadachakka Kuzhachatu (Breadfruit Stir Fry), Parippu Curry, Mathanga Elisseri (Yellow Pumpkin & peas curry ), Pavaka Theeyal (Spicy Bitter-gourd & tamarind gravy) Pineapple Kichadi, Avial, Red Rice & 2 payasams - Ada Pradhaman & Paal Payasam served on a banana leaf.*Takeaway option available between 12-4pm for minimum 2 person.What's an Onam Sadhya?Sadhya is not just about the food but also about community and togetherness. Families and friends come together to prepare and enjoy the meal, reflecting the spirit of unity and prosperity that the festival embodies. Onam Sadhya is a traditional vegetarian feast from Kerala, India, served during the festival of Onam, which celebrates the harvest season and the return of the mythical King Mahabali. The word "Sadhya" means banquet or feast in Malayalam, and this meal is a significant aspect of Onam celebrations.Venue: Love OORU﻿Rooftop / Sunsets / Wine & Grills https://www.instagram.com/love.ooru/?hl=enChef Mako : https://www.instagram.com/chef_mako?igsh=dndubmd6N21wOXBxAkash Murali : https://www.instagram.com/akashfooddoc?igsh=MWtrOXZ6c3JsZWRpbg==

location.address: No. 136, Evergreen PARC, Rooftop, 1st Cross Road, 5th Block,, Koramangala, KHB Colony, 5th Block, Koramangala, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560095, India

organizer.name: love OORU
organizer.description: love.OORU is a tranquil oasis on the rooftop which is the perfect setting for enjoying beautiful sunsets, hosting private dinners & events, and maybe indulging in a chef's table experience.  Taking inspiration from Bengaluru, her history, geography, culture, and most importantly her stories, love.OORU was born as an identity rooted in Bengaluru and all it has to offer.

name: Sip & Read
description: Come, join us for a Sunday where time slows, and the only sound is the gentle hum of turning pages. Sip & Read is back, this time at the cozy HeyBrewty studio, where earthy tones and a soft sun glow welcome us all. 🤗We’ll spend an hour immersed in our books, sipping on tea brews, followed by light-hearted chats that stir up fond reading memories—all with gentle acoustics playing in the background.Bring whatever you love to read—be it a paperback, Kindle, magazine, or newspaper—or explore something new from our library! Consider it a mini getaway from your usual weekend errands, with phones also taking a much-needed rest.Plus, there’ll be fun giveaways for you to take home! ✨📚 Get cozy with a good book alongside fellow readers💬 Jump into lively convos🍷 Enjoy a complimentary tea with a light bite📍 At HeyBrewty Wellness Studio, Ashok NagarBonus: Free Bookmark Premium membership and mementos for keepsakes!

organizer.name: Bookmark App
organizer.description: Bookmark is a dating app for readers. It connects people based on not just what books they like, but also other attributes and interests about their personality, distance, the relationship they are seeking, gender preferences, and more. Download and try it today!

name: Slow Flow Yoga + Flower Binding Therapy + High Tea
description: Slow Flow Yoga + Flower Binding Therapy + High TeaJoin us for an serene afternoon of tranquility and creativity. This unique experience combines a slow yoga flow followed by a flower binding workshop, and a delicious high tea.Event FlowSlow Flow & Flower MeditationWe'll begin with a gentle Slow Flow yoga session, transitioning into a guided flower meditation practice. Each participant will receive a fresh garden rose for the meditation, where you'll explore techniques such as Visualization, Gazing, and Breathwork. These practices will help you cultivate inner peace, gratitude, and a deep connection to the natural world.Flower Binding TherapyFollowing the meditation you will create your own rose bouquet in this therapeutic session, guided by Nidhi from Shades of Spring.Known for its ability to reduce anxiety, enhance creativity, and promote emotional release, flower binding therapy harnesses the high vibrational energy of roses to foster relaxation and mental well-being.High TeaConclude the event with a delightful High Tea experience. Continuing our theme, enjoy a refreshing rose-infused drink and a delicate rose energy ball, as well as canapes, sandwiches and cakes. Everyone will eat and chat together, so it's a lovely chance to meet new people and try new things.

name: Gravy and Pie Shop with Chef Aarohi Sanghavi from MÄKI Patisserie
description: Gravy and Pie Shop at The ConservatoryOur glasshouse transforms into a Gravy & Pie shop for the weekend, serving up brasserie-style food, all doused in rich gravies and sauces.Chef Aarohi Sanghavi from Mäki has drawn inspiration from pies served around the world, applying Mäki’s unique adaptations. name: 'Monsters, Inc.' (2001) Movie Screening | Family Movie Night
description: Family Movie Night at The Studio, Courtyard, ShantinagarJoin us as we watch a series of carefully curated rare masterpieces from around the world, made just for kids. Watch this film while cozying up with your family!Given the nature of the film, we recommend it for children aged 7 and older.About the movie:"Monsters, Inc." is a 2001 animated film by Pixar Animation Studios. Set in the city of Monstropolis, the film explores a world where monsters generate power for their city by scaring children. The story follows two main characters: Sulley, a large, gentle blue monster with purple spots, and his best friend Mike Wazowski, a small, green, one-eyed monster.Why Attend?Broaden Horizons with Global Tales: Dive into diverse artistic expressions through rare masterpieces curated for children.Quality Family Bonding: Embark on a cinematic journey to a new country each month, forging lasting memories and strengthening family connections.Uncover Hidden Treasures: Discover lesser-known gems handpicked for their artistic brilliance and captivating storytelling.Artistic Excellence: Immerse your child in films of unparalleled artistic merit, fueling their imagination and creativity.Safe Family Environment: Enjoy movies in a secure, family-friendly setting, ensuring a worry-free experience for kids and parents alike.Don't miss this opportunity to create lasting memories with your family while exposing your kids to the wonders of world cinema.Join us for Family Movie Night – where the magic of storytelling knows no bounds!Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.The Event is taking place at Courtyard's indoor Studio space on the second floor.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. name: Janapada Kala Darshana
description: "Janapada Kala Darshana" is a vibrant and cultural event that celebrates the essence of rural life, traditions and cuisine of Karnataka. Explore the rich heritage and history of the region with a guided museum tour at Jana Pada loka, showcasing artifacts and exhibits that highlight the cultural significance of the area.Enjoy sumptuous traditional meals at Kamat Lokaruchi, featuring an array of authentic local dishes that are served in a picturesque traditional village setup, offering a taste of rural life.Visit to chennapatna toy workshop run by Shilpa Trust, where artisans craft exquisite traditional toys, offering insights into the age-old art of toy making. Immerse yourself in the cultural heritage of the region with captivating performances like Dollu Kunitha, a dynamic and rhythmic drum dance."Janapada Kala Darshana" promises a delightful blend of cultural immersion, culinary delights, and interactive experiences that showcase the beauty of rural life and traditions.Special Offer: Enjoy a delightful 20% discount by using the coupon code "GVM20" at checkout. Valid until midnight tonight.

Russell, is a romantic comedy-drama based on the novel by Matthew Quick.?Pat Solitano (Bradley Cooper) is a former teacher who has just been released from a mental health facility after a period of treatment for bipolar disorder. name: Onam Sadya
description: To celebrate the festival of Onam, we bring to you as our next pop up an authentic Onam Sadya. Enjoy the taste of Kerala with our Onam Sadya, featuring 25 traditional dishes served on a banana leaf. For a modern twist, we also offer a few select non-vegetarian options to complement the feast, creating a perfect blend of tradition and flavour.Here is a glimpse of the menu:1.⁠ ⁠Sambaram - Spiced buttermilk.2.⁠ ⁠Uppu - Salt.3.Naalu Keeri Upperi - Banana chips cut into four triangles.4.⁠ ⁠Sarkara Varatti - Jaggery-coated banana chips.5.⁠ ⁠Inji Puli - Ginger-tamarind chutney.6.⁠ ⁠Naaraanga Achar - Lemon pickle.7.⁠ ⁠Maanga Achar- Mango pickle.8.⁠ ⁠Beetroot Pachadi - Yogurt-based beetroot dish.9.⁠ ⁠Pineapple Pachadi - Yogurt-based pineapple dish.10.⁠ ⁠Cabbage Thoran - Cabbage with coconut.11.⁠ ⁠Aviyal - Mixed vegetable curry.12.⁠ ⁠Olan - Ash gourd and cowpeas in coconut milk.13.⁠ ⁠Mathanga Erissery - Pumpkin and coconut curry.14.⁠ ⁠Koottu Curry - Mixed vegetable and lentil curry.15.⁠ ⁠Kuthari / Ponni Ari - Red rice/White rice.16. Katti parippu - Simple cooked dal with ghee.17.⁠ ⁠Sambar 18.⁠ ⁠Moru Curry - Spiced curd curry.19.⁠ ⁠Rasam 20.⁠ ⁠Pappadam 21.⁠ ⁠Meen Porichath - Spicy fried fish.22.⁠ ⁠Kozhi Roast - Dry, spicy chicken roast.23.⁠ ⁠Koonthal Roast - Spicy squid roast.24.⁠ ⁠Chemeen Chammanthi - Shrimp and coconut chutney.25.⁠ ⁠Boli and Paalada Pradhaman PayasamTerms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked. Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. name: Toast Pasta Bar, Mumbai at The Conservatory
description: About the MealBangalore, get ready to experience the culinary magic of one of Mumbai’s most loved spots—Toast Pasta Bar! We’re thrilled to host their first-ever pop-up in the city at The Conservatory. Known for its inventive handmade pasta, Toast Pasta Bar, led by the talented Chef Devika Manjrekar, is set to bring its bold flavors and creative twists to our space.The exclusive pop-up menu will feature a selection of their most cherished dishes, blending authentic Italian techniques with the freshest local produce, and reimagined in Chef Devika’s signature style. It’s a unique chance for Bangaloreans to savor the iconic flavors that have made Toast Pasta Bar a sensation in Mumbai, now paired with the best of our region’s seasonal ingredients.Chef Devika shares on her debut in Bangalore, “I’m excited to bring Toast Pasta Bar to a new audience. The Conservatory’s beautiful ambiance and focus on quality make it the perfect setting for this pop-up. We can’t wait to create a memorable experience for everyone who joins us.”Meet Chef Devika Manjrekar at The ConservatoryDevika Manjrekar, Chef & entrepreneur, is the creative force behind Mumbai's Beloved Toast Pasta Bar and Toast Doughnut Shop. Devika’s culinary journey began at 17, inspired by Jamie Oliver, and countless episodes of Masterchef Australia.
